The 'Hengsteysee' (Lake Hengstey) is a reservoir on the Ruhr river between the
cities of Hagen, Dortmund and Herdecke, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. It was
built in 1929 and is one of five reservoirs on the Ruhr.

The reservoir is about long and has an average width of . It begins near the
point where the Lenne flows into the Ruhr, and ends with the weir and
hydroelectric plant of Hengsteysee. The Klusenberg, a hill that is part of the
Ardey range, is located just north of the Hengsteysee. There is also a pumped-
storage plant on this reservoir, named Koepchenwerk after Arthur Koepchen.

Hengsteysee fulfills the following four functions:

*functions as the lower reservoir of the Koepchenwerk pumped-storage plant
*performs biological purification of water from the Lenne *deposit of sediment
from the Lenne *venue for water sports and tourism
